events.title: Executive Order 9066 Signed by President Franklin D. Roosevelt
events.description: President Roosevelt signed Executive Order 9066, authorizing the internment of Japanese Americans during World War II.
events.significance: This order led to the forced relocation and incarceration of about 120,000 Japanese Americans, significantly impacting civil liberties and raising issues of racial discrimination in the United States.

events.title: Thomas Edison Patents the Phonograph
events.description: Thomas Edison was granted a patent for his invention of the phonograph, a device capable of recording and reproducing sound.
events.significance: The phonograph was a groundbreaking invention that laid the foundation for the modern music industry and audio recording technologies.

events.title: Dardanelles Campaign Stage One Ends
events.description: Allied troops evacuate from the Gallipoli Peninsula during World War I, concluding the first phase of the Dardanelles Campaign.
events.significance: The withdrawal marked a significant defeat for the Allies, impacting the strategic situation in the Ottoman Empire and boosting morale in Turkey.

events.title: First Induction Ceremony of the Baseball Hall of Fame
events.description: The National Baseball Hall of Fame in Cooperstown, New York, held its inaugural induction ceremony.
events.significance: The ceremony honored legendary players and helped solidify baseball as America's national pastime.

events.title: Kosovo Declares Independence from Serbia
events.description: Kosovo's parliament declared independence, leading to international debates over sovereignty and recognition.
events.significance: The declaration marked a crucial moment in Balkan history, influencing regional stability and international law regarding self-determination.
